intro: Lepismium bolivianum, commonly known as the Bolivian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically white or violet in color, often with a strong fragrance. It is a perennial shrub that can grow up to several meters in height, with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Lepismium bolivianum is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats.
